main_definition: Expiration refers to the end of a period or term, especially in relation to contracts, agreements, medications, or natural processes.

meanings_and_examples.definition: End of validity for legal documents
meanings_and_examples.example: The expiration date on his passport indicated that he had 5 more years before needing to renew it.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Termination of a contract or agreement
meanings_and_examples.example: Our lease is set to expire in six months, and we'll have to decide whether to renew it or find another place to live.

meanings_and_examples.definition: End of the shelf life for medication
meanings_and_examples.example: The bottle of antibiotics was past its expiration date, so I had to dispose of it properly and buy a new one.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Cessation or end of natural processes
meanings_and_examples.example: As the leaves began to fall, it signaled the approaching winter season, marking an expiration for many plants' active growth phase.
